value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #05: Remove table filters
value.excerpt: Don't remove filters from tables when you want to remove column filters. Learn the difference and fix your DAX formulas! How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function:

value.title: Create Static Tables in DAX Using the DATATABLE Function
value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types. Article and download: https://sql.bi/27271/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Disabling auto date-time in Power BI
value.excerpt: This video shows how to disable the date table automatically created by Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/137706

value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/

value.title: Introducing ALLSELECTED in DAX
value.excerpt: Introduction to ALLSELECTED, which is an extremely complex function to use in DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/760153?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Lookup multiple values in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn different advanced techniques to retrieve multiple values from a lookup table in DAX, improving code readability and performance in DAX queries. Article and download: https://sql.bi/43801?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Understanding the difference between LASTDATE and MAX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video explains why in many cases, MAX should be used instead of LASTDATE to search for the last date in a time period using DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/673766?aff=yt

value.title: Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX
value.excerpt: Improve DAX queries by using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS when you create table expressions. value.title: Use DAX in Power BI Desktop to solve business problems
value.excerpt: In this module, you’ll solve three different business problems by optimizing the data model and creating Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) calculations.

value.title: #1 DAX Fridays! 101: The basics of the DAX Language
value.excerpt: In today's video I want to go through the basics of DAX and explain basic pitfalls that you will fall into if you come from excel or are a business user. #daxfridays #dax #curbal   Have a great Friday!  Calculated column vs measure video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SmXLgEHXSGc  Vertipag (DAX engine

value.title: #2 DAX Fridays! 101: Introduction to filter and row context
value.excerpt: Are you new to DAX and want to learn what those things called filter context and row context are? I will attempt to do just that in today's video. Let me know how I did in the comments :) #dax #powerbi #daxfridays #curbal  Happy friday!  DAX 101 playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLDz00l_jz6zwdC_xdTp_QANkHYIzs1BJG&disable_polymer=true

value.title: #5 DAX Fridays! 101: Order of evaluation for DAX formulas
value.excerpt: It is time to get cracking again with some DAX 101, this time we will talk about in what order DAX executes its functions. Happy Friday!  Get Northwind Dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  Link to DAX Fridays survey: http://bit.ly/2MMM4KK   Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays! #10: RANK/ TOPN with slicer
value.excerpt: In this video you will learn how to create a custom slicer that will rank your data based on the criteria that you specify, for example, Top 3, Top 5 and Top 10.  PREVIOUS VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z2qzJVeYhTY NEXT VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kaPNxB-Hkvw   RANKX Tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z2qzJVeYhTY

value.title: DAX Fridays! #105: ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: The DAX function ISINSCOPE, allow us to work with hierarchies in Power BI. In this video I will go through an example on how to do that. This DAX function was introduced in the November 2018 Power BI Desktop Update, so make sure you have that installed if you wan to test it out.  Other resources:  DAX

value.title: DAX Fridays! #13: EARLIER
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function EARLIER in DAX/ Powerpivot.  Link to pbix and excel file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/earlier-dax  EARLIER is mostly used in the context of calculated columns.  The performance of EARLIER might be slow because it theoretically, it might have to perform a number of operations
